VarEvents Library¶

Events Definitions¶

VarEvents.Events = {'decreased': <function <lambda> at 0x2b06f7ef8488>, 'changed': <function <lambda> at 0x2b06f7ef8398>, 'increased': <function <lambda> at 0x2b06f7ef8410>}¶

Dictionary of events that can be raised by watched variables. Custom events may be added to this dictionary and they will be raised when their functions return a True value.

Watched Variable Class¶

class VarEvents.Var(init, readonly=False, blocking=False, recursion=False, reporter=None)[source]¶

Watched variable class. This class imitates the variable to which it is assigned. It then raises any appropriate events when it is updated.

init: The value the variable should be initialized to. This can be of virtually an type.
readonly: [Optional] If the variable should allow itself to be easily updated. Readonly variables can still force an update. Default is False.
blocking: [Optional] If this variable’s event handlers should be defaulted to block the main thread or not. Default is False.
recursion: [Optional] If this variable’s event handlers should be defaulted to allow recursion. Default is False.
reporter: A ‘reporter function’ that is called any time the variable is updated. A silent update will not call this function.
Variables:
  • events – Events that this variable is watching for.
  • readonly – If this variable is readonly.
  • blocking – If this variable blocks the main thread.
  • recursion – If this variable allows recursion.
  • reporter – Reporter function for this variable.
__fwd__(event)[source]¶

Forwards an event to a handler.

__init__(init, readonly=False, blocking=False, recursion=False, reporter=None)[source]¶

Var(init, readonly, blocking, recursion) Creates and instance of the Var class init - Initial value of the variable readonly - Optional, Toggles Read Only Mode blocking - Optional, Toggles Blocking Mode recursion - Optional, Toggles Recurison Mode

__proxy__(fun, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates a proxy object that allows its attributes to be called.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

copy()[source]¶

Provides a duplicate of the current value.

subscribe(event=None, fun=None, handler=None)[source]¶

Subscribes a handler to an event. Event and fun must be supplied if handler is not. If handler is supplied, event and fun will be ignored. This method returns an object of type Handler

event: The name of the event to subscribe to (ie ‘changed’).
fun: The function to call when the given event occurs.
handler: Optinally, a pre-existing event handler may be alternatively supplied. This is of type Handler
unsubscribe(eid)[source]¶

Unsubscribes the handler with the given id.

eid: The event id to unsubscribe.
update(value, force=False, silent=False)[source]¶

Updates the value of the variable. Forwards events to handlers as appropriate.

value: The new value for the variable.
force: If this update should be forced (for readonly variables).
silent: If this update should be silent (not call the reporter).

Watched Property Class¶

class VarEvents.Property(default, readonly=False, blocking=False, recursion=False)[source]¶

Property Class. This allows a watched variable to act as an instance level variable in a class. It MUST be an instance level variable. It may not be created during init or any other method. This class will imitate a Var class except that the update function need not be called when accessing this variable as an instance level variable inside an object.

default: The value the variable should be initialized to. This can be of virtually an type.
readonly: [Optional] If the variable should allow itself to be easily updated. Readonly variables can still force an update. Default is False.
blocking: [Optional] If this variable’s event handlers should be defaulted to block the main thread or not. Default is False.
recursion: [Optional] If this variable’s event handlers should be defaulted to allow recursion. Default is False.
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

Event Handler Class¶

class VarEvents.Handler(fun, handles, event, eid=None, blocking=False, recursion=False)[source]¶

Handler class that fires events when appropriate. This is returned when an event is created. It can also be used to unsubscribe from a watched variable’s event.

fun: Handler function to run
handles: Var instance to respond to
event: String for name of event to respond to
eid: Optional, ID of handler if subscribed
blocking: Optional, Toggles Blocking Mode
recursion: Optional, Toggle Recursive Mode
Variables:
  • blocking – Controls if the handler should run as a thread. When blocking is off (False), the event runs in a thread and does not block the thread from which it was fired.
  • recursion – Controls if the handler should be allowed to run recusively. If this is off (False), the event can only be running once at any time.
  • running – Indicates if the handler is currently running.
__del__()[source]¶

Unsubscribe from events on deletion. Don’t rely on this.

__repr__()[source]¶

Returns an informative string about the handler.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

fire()[source]¶

Fires the event as a thread.

run()[source]¶

Runs the handler function.

subscribe()[source]¶

Adds the handler’s subscription to events.

unsubscribe()[source]¶

Removes the handler’s subscription to events.
